org.concordion.cubano.driver.action

Class ActionTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.concordion.cubano.driver.action.ActionTimer

  • public class ActionTimer
extends java.lang.Object

    Logs the duration of an action.

      • start

        public static ActionTimer start(org.slf4j.Logger logger,
                                java.lang.String format,
                                java.lang.Object... args)

        Start a new timer, logging the supplied message.

        Example: 

        ActionTimer timer = ActionTimer.start(LOGGER, “Starting action”);

        Parameters:
        logger - Logger to use for any logging
        format - Formatted message string, argument place holders can be embedded with {} marker
        args - List of arguments for the message format string
        Returns:
        new ActionTimer

      • stop

        public void stop(java.lang.String format,
                 java.lang.Object... args)

        Log supplied message.

        Example: 

        timer.stop(“Action completed in {} seconds”, timer.duration().getSeconds());

        Parameters:
        format - Formatted message string, argument place holders can be embedded with {} marker
        args - List of arguments for the message format string

      • stop

        Parameters:

        format - Formatted message string, argument place holders can be embedded with {} marker
        args - List of arguments for the message format string

      • hasPassed

        public boolean hasPassed(java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit unit,
                         long duration)

        Check if timer has passed supplied duration.

        Parameters:
        unit - Unit of time
        duration - Duration
        Returns:
        True if time since timer was started is more that supplied value
